```
Benchmark                                                                                 cpu_time    real_time
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  ----------  -----------
BM_PumpStreamClientToServer<InProcess>/262144                                             -7%         -7%
BM_PumpStreamServerToClient<InProcess>/32768                                              -6%         -6%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/262144/1/1     +4%         +4%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/262144/2/1     +5%         +5%

```

A namespace would achieve the same in a more idiomatic way in my opinion.

On Fri, 25 May 2018, 08:11 Mark D. Roth, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@markdroth* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/client_channel.cc
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/15480#discussion_r190924790>:
>
> >
> -// Note: This runs under the client_channel combiner, but will NOT be
> -// holding the call combiner.
> -static void pick_callback_cancel_locked(void* arg, grpc_error* error) {
> -  grpc_call_element* elem = static_cast<grpc_call_element*>(arg);
> -  channel_data* chand = static_cast<channel_data*>(elem->channel_data);
> -  call_data* calld = static_cast<call_data*>(elem->call_data);
> -  // Note: chand->lb_policy may have changed since we started our pick,
> -  // in which case we will be cancelling the pick on a policy other than
> -  // the one we started it on.  However, this will just be a no-op.
> -  if (error != GRPC_ERROR_NONE && chand->lb_policy != nullptr) {
> +// Performs subchannel pick via LB policy.
> +class LbPicker {
>
> I did it this way to group all of the methods related to the LB pick
> together, so that it's more obvious to readers that this is where we
> interact with the LB policy. I'm trying to break this huge file up into
> smaller pieces that are easier to understand.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because your review was requested.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/15480#discussion_r190924790>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAHVmQg4u8AVxvTRYLIoZPoiQHGfqeM7ks5t2B8vgaJpZM4UHNH9>
> .
>

I think using a class provides cleaner encapsulation.  It also allows us to keep the `DoneLocked()` and `CancelLocked()` methods private, so that they're only accessible by the public `StartLocked()` method.
